intro: Echeandia texensis, commonly known as the Texas echium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, hot climates. Echeandia texensis is often found in rocky areas and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
